question: I’m an odd number. Remove one letter from my name and I become even. What number am I?
Multiply me by any other number and the result is always me. What number am I?
Find the next number in the sequence: 2, 3, 5, 9, 17, ?
What three positive integers give the same result when added as when multiplied?
If you write every number from 1 to 100 (inclusive), how many times does the digit 1 appear?
hint: Count in both the tens and ones place.

question: I’m a two-digit number. When you reverse my digits and subtract the smaller from the larger you get 27. My digits add to 9. What number am I?
Which weighs more — a kilogram of steel or a kilogram of feathers?
Which single-digit number equals the number of letters in its English name?
Pick any two-digit number, reverse its digits, subtract the smaller from the larger, then add the digits of the result. What is the final answer every time?
